Grammar.Abbreviations and acronyms: Spell out first use; avoid unnecessary acronyms. Maintain clarity.
Grammar.Ampersands: Use '&' only in UI constraints (buttons, labels). Prefer 'and' in sentences.
Grammar.Articles (a, an, the): Use articles to improve readability and natural tone. Avoid omission for brevity.
Grammar.Capitalization: Follow sentence‑case for readability. Reserve title‑case for proper nouns and UI titles.
Grammar.Contractions: Use natural contractions for friendly tone. Avoid stiffness.
Grammar.Noun stacks: Limit consecutive nouns to avoid cognitive load. Use prepositions to clarify.
Grammar.Plurals: Pluralize naturally. Avoid jargon or awkward plural forms.
Grammar.Spelling: Use consistent regional spelling (likely US English). Avoid informal shortcuts.
Grammar.Simple past vs. Present perfect: Use simple past for completed actions; present perfect for recent relevance.
Grammar.Syllable separation: Hyphenate only where clarity improves. Avoid over‑hyphenation.

Punctuation.Colons: Use to introduce lists or clarifications. Avoid overuse.
Punctuation.Commas: Support readability; use in lists and clauses. Avoid comma splices.
Punctuation.Dashes: En dashes for ranges, em dashes for emphasis. Use sparingly.
Punctuation.Ellipses: Use for unfinished thoughts, not pauses. Avoid dramatic overuse.
Punctuation.Emojis \ud83e\udd20: Use sparingly and only when tone supports. Ensure accessibility.
Punctuation.Exclamation marks: Use rarely. Avoid sounding unprofessional or emotional.
Punctuation.Hyphens: Use to clarify compound terms. Avoid unnecessary connection.
Punctuation.Parentheses: Use for clarifications. Avoid burying key info inside.
Punctuation.Periods: End full thoughts cleanly. Avoid missing punctuation.
Punctuation.Possessives: Follow standard possessive rules. Avoid awkward constructions.
Punctuation.Quotation marks: Use for direct quotes and UI terms. Avoid scare quotes.
Punctuation.Semicolons: Use to link related independent clauses. Avoid excessive formality.
